column3: Question_Text
How is AI prioritized in management meetings?
Does a documented AI strategy or roadmap exist?
How is AI funding and investment handled?
What is your goal regarding AI vs. competitors?
How do employees generally react to the topic of AI?
To what extent are AI capabilities and technical literacy established across your workforce? E.g. expertise in machine learning and NLP, as well as general AI literacy for non-technical staff.
column6: Unaware / Non-Existent - We lack clarity on our current AI proficiency, and there are no identifiable AI skills or initiatives within the workforce.
column7: Isolated Proficiency - AI knowledge is siloed within a few individuals; significant skill gaps across most departments currently hinder broader adoption.
column8: Foundational Competency - Core team members possess foundational AI skills, and structured upskilling programs are underway to prepare the broader workforce.
column9: Advanced Operational Capability - Advanced AI practitioners are integrated into multiple roles, supported by continuous training that keeps pace with industry trends.
column10: Strategic Expert Leadership - AI expertise is a core competency company-wide; internal specialists lead R&D, mentor staff, and drive industry-leading innovation.

column3: How often do employees receive AI training?
Is it "okay" to fail with an AI pilot project?
What types of business data do you actively collect? (Select all that apply)
Do you currently use any of these technologies? (Select all that apply)
column11: Business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

column3: Describe the "cleanliness" of your business data.
How comfortable is your team with data insights?
How rigorously does your organization validate the technical and regulatory feasibility of an AI use case before committing resources?
column6: Minimal / Unsure – We do not have a formal feasibility check; projects are often started based on excitement or intuition without verifying data or compliance requirements first.
column7: Reactive Assessment – We perform basic checks only after a project has started, often leading to delays or "stuck" projects when data or legal issues unexpectedly emerge.
column8: Basic Due Diligence – We have an informal "Pre-Check" for major projects where we verify if the necessary data exists and if there are obvious legal hurdles.
column9: Structured Validation – We use a clear "Go/No-Go" process for every use case that validates data readiness, process alignment, and regulatory compliance before any budget is released.
column10: Optimized Strategic Filtering – We use a standardized, data-driven validation engine that ensures every initiative is perfectly aligned with business goals, technical capabilities, and compliance standards from the start.

column3: How many AI use cases are currently active?
Do you measure the financial impact of AI projects?
To what extent does AI address concrete bottlenecks in your core business operations rather than experimental topics?
column6: AI initiatives are mostly exploratory and disconnected from core business bottlenecks.
column7: Some AI use cases touch core processes, but they are not focused on the most critical constraints.
column8: AI is applied to known bottlenecks in the core business, with mixed or unproven impact.
column9: AI systematically targets high-impact bottlenecks in core business operations and delivers measurable improvements.
column10: AI is a strategic lever to remove or redefine core business bottlenecks and shapes how the business competes.

column3: Are core processes documented and repeatable?
How structured is your approach to planning, implementing, and delivering AI-related projects?
column6: Undefined / Ad-hoc – We do not have a set process for AI projects; tasks are handled as they arise without formal planning or clear ownership.
column7: Individual Initiative – Project delivery depends on the effort of specific individuals; while some projects succeed, we lack a repeatable "playbook" for the whole team.
column8: Basic Standardization – We use a consistent workflow (e.g., simple task tracking or weekly sprints) that allows us to manage AI projects with predictable timelines.
column9: Targeted & Results-Oriented – We use a process specifically adapted for AI (e.g., early prototyping and data-readiness checks), ensuring we don't waste resources on unfeasible ideas.
column10: High-Velocity Delivery – Our implementation engine is highly efficient; we can rapidly move from a "Proof of Concept" to a live tool with minimal friction and clear ROI tracking.

column3: How long to implement a new digital tool?
Is there a defined path to move AI idea to production?
Do you have an internal "AI Code of Conduct"?
How strictly is data handled according to the EU AI Act?
Who is responsible for AI outcomes and errors?
What disclosure requirements exist for external partners?
To what extent do you use Cloud infrastructure?
What types of AI development tools are currently available in your organization? (Select all that apply)
column6: No AI development tools are currently available (Exclusive option)
column7: Pre-built AI tools or platforms (e.g., analytics, chatbots, automation tools)
column8: Custom AI or machine learning development tools
column9: Cloud-based AI services (e.g., managed AI/ML platforms)
column10: A combination of pre-built and custom AI tools

column3: How easily can you scale new software company-wide?
Why are you doing this AI assessment?
column6: External Pressure – We are responding to external hype or competitor moves without a clear internal goal.
column7: Resource Optimization – We want to identify where AI can reduce costs or automate repetitive manual tasks.
column8: Strategic Clarity – We need a professional roadmap to align AI initiatives with our core business objectives.
column9: Readiness Check – We aim to evaluate our technical infrastructure and workforce skills for upcoming scaling.
column10: Competitive Advantage – We are seeking to define a market-leading position through high-impact AI innovation.

column3: Which business challenge is your top priority? (Select all that apply)
How is AI influencing your organization’s strategy?
column6: No Impact – We have not assessed AI trends and have no documented strategy regarding them.
column7: Reactive – We acknowledge the trend but only respond to external pressures on an ad-hoc basis.
column8: Exploratory – We monitor trends and have initiated pilot projects to address specific needs.
column9: Strategic – AI is a key planning driver with a formal roadmap for systematic integration.
column10: Innovative – We leverage AI to redefine our business model and set industry standards.

column3: Who is the primary driver of AI within your organization? (Select all that apply)
Are you in charge of AI initiatives?
Which option best describes your position and decision authority? (Select all that apply)
